text:
I installed httpd-2.0.47 on my Mandrakelinux 10.1 system running 
kernel 2.6.8.  I started with ./configure, then make, then make install.  I 
did not supply any configuration options.  When I run ./apachectl all I get is 
a seg fault (bin/apachectl: line 87:  2503 Segmentation fault      (core 
dumped) $HTTPD $ARGV). 


My trace is shown below:

(gdb) r -DONE_PROCESS
Starting program: /usr/local/apache2/bin/httpd -DONE_PROCESS
[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled]
[New Thread 1077271456 (LWP 23724)]

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
[Switching to Thread 1077271456 (LWP 23724)]
0x080944b6 in register_hooks ()
(gdb) where
#0  0x080944b6 in register_hooks ()
#1  0x08081548 in ap_setup_prelinked_modules (process=0x80b8120) at config.c:645
#2  0x08084b23 in main (argc=2, argv=0xbffff5a4) at main.c:439
creator: raman.ooty@gmail.com
jorton@redhat.com
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 30437 ***
